column2: Every artist was first an amateur. Ralph Waldo Emerson
column3: You don't take a photograph, you make it. Ansel Adams
column4: A picture is a poem without words. Horace
column5: Art enables us to find ourselves and lose ourselves at the same time. Thomas Merton
column6: Creativity is contagious. Pass it on. Albert Einstein
column7: The role of art is to ask questions. Not to answer them. Anton Chekhov
column8: Art is the only serious thing in the world. And the artist is the only person who is never serious. Oscar Wilde
column9: Art wasn’t supposed to look nice; it was supposed to make you feel something. Rainbow Rowell
column10: The great artist is the simplifier. Vincent Van Gogh
column11: We must never forget that art is not a form of propaganda; it is a form of truth. John F. Kennedy
column12: An artist`s work is utterly incomprehensible and therefore full of deep significance. Calvin

column2: Always live your life with your biography in mind. Marisha Pessl
column3: Read no history--nothing but biography, for that is life without theory. Benjamin Disraeli
column4: Just as there is nothing between the admirable omelet and the intolerable, so with autobiography. Hilaire Belloc
column5: Biography should be written by an acute enemy. Arthur Balfour
column6: Biography is: a system in which the contradictions of a human life are unified. José Ortega y Gasset
column7: Only when one has lost all curiosity about the future has one reached the age to write an autobiography. Evelyn Waugh
column8: A well-written life is almost as rare as a well-spent one. Thomas Carlyle
column9: Great geniuses have the shortest biographies. Ralph Waldo Emerson
column10: There is properly no history; only biography. Ralph Waldo Emerson

column2: There are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation, hard work, and learning from failure. Colin Powell
column3: There is always space for improvement, no matter how long you've been in the business. Oscar De La Hoya
column4: A brand for a company is like a reputation for a person. You earn reputation by trying to do hard things well. Jeff Bezos
column5: It doesn't matter whether you are pursuing success in business, sports, the arts, or life in general: The bridge between wishing and accomplishing is discipline. Harvey Mackay
column6: Great things in business are never done by one person. They're done by a team of people. Steve Jobs
column7: The entrepreneur always searches for change, responds to it, and exploits it as an opportunity. Peter Drucker
column8: If people like you, they'll listen to you, but if they trust you, they'll do business with you. Zig Ziglar

column2: Food is not just eating energy. It's an experience.
If you think you have it tough, read history books. Bill Maher
The very essence of romance is uncertainty. Oscar Wilde, The Importance of Being Earnest and Other Plays
He who controls the spice controls the universe. Frank Herbert, Dune
column3: Everything's science fiction until someone makes it science fact. Marie Lu, Warcross
column4: Books are keys that open many doors. James Rollins
column5: Science is my territory, but science fiction is the landscape of my dreams. Freeman John Dyson, Imagined Worlds
